Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or specific details to back up the statement that Special Counsel Robert Mueller "never pushed" to have investigators interview President Donald Trump.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Special Counsel Robert Mueller had a responsibility or obligation to push for investigators to interview President Donald Trump, but it does not provide any justification for this assumption.
Understate: The claim may understate the role of Special Counsel Robert Mueller in the investigation by suggesting that he did not actively pursue an interview with President Donald Trump. This may not fully capture the complexities and efforts involved in the investigation.
Falters at times: The claim may falter at times as it does not provide a comprehensive analysis of the actions and decisions made by Special Counsel Robert Mueller during the investigation. It may overlook important factors or considerations.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or possibilities for why Special Counsel Robert Mueller may not have pushed for investigators to interview President Donald Trump. It presents a one-sided perspective without acknowledging other potential reasons or constraints.
